I have a portfolio I am building for a Gen Z relative and I am just living off of the dividend payouts in the meantime so we both win.  When I take the dirt nap that relative will have the opportunity to sell the inheritance for trivial or no taxes due to something called the step-up in cost basis.  So I am at least doing something to help.  In your case, you will have to take a step back from your situation and assess your finances.  You are going to find things you are spending money on that you are not using.  You are going to find things that you are spending too much for because of convenience.  There is your money.  This would be "Beer money" for some people, but not you.  Stop paying for things you are not using.  Learn to do things the hard way to eliminate paying a premium for convenience.  Stuff money in a sock until you can get a couple grand.  Open a brokerage account with that and just buy VOO and forget about it.  That is an S&P 500 index fund that is about as safe as you can get.  Get used to dumping that money each month as a bill, but you are paying yourself.  Never sell and continue to accumulate dividends over the years and set those dividends to reinvest into new shares.  Don't touch it, just feed it for 30 years with your beer money, or add more if you get into a fortunate position.
